column4: why would my ubuntu server be the only computer in the network whose hostname is not resolved by my router?
because your server has a static IP allocation ?
it doesnt. got the ip via dhcp
What DHCP server is in use?
my router is dhcp server ;)  idk what they are using exactly
when you say the server's name won't resolve. How are you attempting to resolve it? what are you using?
nslookup says  " server can't find ***-uls: NXDOMAIN"
Are you postfixing the local domain onto the hostname for nslookup?
sry, dunno what that means, so i guess not? ;)
usually a network has a domain part and a hostname for each device. E.g. myserver.lan.mydomain.net (myserver is the hostname) so you have to lookup the hostname.domain
mhm ok, dnsdomainname -A  just shows an empty line... could that be the problem?
On my network I do something like "dig mypc.lan.iam.tj" (or "nslookup mypc.lan.iam.tj")
It depends on how you've configured the local DHCP/DNS server - what domain you've told it is local
yeh i understand. weird thing is just that it works with other computers (also ubuntu)
It could be that the server isn't sending its hostname to the DHCP server
Have you got any static assignments in the DHCP router?
i think i might have found the problem
might have been an error in the resolv.conf ... thx for your help anyways!
